item.title: How Dragon Age: The Veilguard Twists the Knife for Lucanis and Neve Lovers
item.description:
The following includes SPOILERS for major plot elements of Dragon Age: The Veilguard.

Dragon Age: The Veilguard features seven recruitable and romanceable companions, including a mix of new and returning characters. Even prior to the game's release, each of the seven had already amassed eager and excited fans. However, fans of two of Dragon Age: The Veilguard's companions - Shadow Dragon detective Neve Gallus and Antivan Crow assassin Lucanis Dellamorte - may be both frustrated and intrigued by the game's unique handling of their stories.

Neve And Lucanis' Arcs Are Heavily Influenced By Player Decisions

While the player interacts with all six factions throughout Dragon Age: The Veilguard, the fate of Neve's Shadow Dragons and Lucanis' Antivan Crows is entirely determined by a major choice made in Chapter 6 of the game's story. When both Crow headquarters Treviso and Shadow Dragon-controlled Dock Town are attacked by the gods, the player can only choose one to save.

The decision affects the rest of the game, including Neve and Lucanis themselves. The city not saved becomes Blighted, with many NPCs dying, and the associated faction nearly wiped out. Players lose favor with the Shadow Dragons or Crows, and can no longer access their merchants to sell valuables. Which side quests are available in the city also changes, although content like treasure chests and Fen'Harel altars can still be accessed. However, arguably the greatest change involves Neve and Lucanis themselves.

Neve And Lucanis Become Hardened And Difficult To Bond With

The companion whose city is Blighted will temporarily leave the party, becoming unavailable for several quests. When they return, they will be Hardened, unwilling to use support or healing abilities and relying only on their offensive skills. Their bond with Rook will grow much more slowly, and they will be suspicious of Rook's intentions. The contents of their companion quests and dialogue scenes will be altered to reflect the weakened state of their faction.

While they can still be romanced, accessing this path is much more difficult - indicated by dialogue choices saying "may allow romance with Neve/Lucanis" rather than "indicates romantic feelings." If a player chooses not to romance either, they may also end up in a romantic relationship with one another - ironically, based around the non-Hardened one showing sympathy to the Hardened, realizing that their faction could have easily suffered the same fate.

Player Choice Is Stripped Regarding Neve And Lucanis' Fates

Ultimately, a Hardened Neve or Lucanis can still survive Dragon Age: The Veilguard, but it is much harder to do so. With their bond growth slowed, players may struggle with maximizing it and reaching Hero of the Veilguard status. A companion who is not a Hero of the Veilguard has a much higher chance of dying during the game's final chapters - so a player may do everything they can to save a Hardened companion and still wind up failing.

Additionally, a Hardened Neve or Lucanis will not rely on Rook, which is ultimately reflected in the game taking major faction-related decisions out of the player's hands. In the Shadow Dragons' case, it is who becomes the new archon of a slowly rebuilding Minrathous. For the Crows, it is how Lucanis handles the traitor within their ranks. Rook can only make one of these decisions, as only the city they choose to save will accept their input.

In some ways, the city blighting and its impact gives additional depth to Neve and Lucanis, allowing them to grow through a deep and emotional character arc. However, it can also be heartbreaking for fans of the character to see them suffer or try to win their love only to be rejected due to their new Hardened outlook. Only one thing is certain - players who love both Neve and Lucanis will need to play The Veilguard multiple times to experience their full stories.

item.title: The Sims 4: All Tarot Cards (& How to Find Them)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get the High Spellcaster Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Cups Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Coins Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Wands Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Swords Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Star Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Justice Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Empress Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Evil Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Tower Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Wheel Of Fortune Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Suspension Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Hermit Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Chariot Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the World Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Temperance Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Moon Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Advocate Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Fool Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Lovers Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Emperor Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Judgement Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Strength Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Magician Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Sun Tarot Card in The Sims 4
  • How to Get the Death Tarot Card in The Sims 4

The Sims Life and Death expansion pack brings a new collectible for players to complete. Although every player starts with a basic tarot card deck, there is a special deck to discover: The Lady Ravendancer Tarot Deck .

With the Lady Ravendancer Tarot Deck, players can not only perform readings for other Sims, as they can with their basic deck but also access extra features like summoning the spirit of Lady Ravendancer. Completing the deck requires collecting all 26 cards, which takes the player around every neighborhood in Ravenwood.

1 How to Get the High Spellcaster Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: High Spellcaster
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: The first card the Sim receives

The High Spellcaster tarot card is given automatically when the Sim begins their Lady Ravendancer Tarot Card Deck challenge in The Sims 4 .

To start collecting, gamers have to visit any one of the Tarot Tomes in the Ravenwood neighborhoods. Once there, they must approach the plinth, interact with the tome, and learn about the Order of Lenore, who the Sim will meet later.

2 How to Get the Cups Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Cups
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Explore a Crypt in Ravenwood

The Cups is one of four tarot cards players will find as they explore any of the Crypts in Ravenwood. These cards appear randomly, and the Sim may have to explore the Crypt more than once to find each of them.

3 How to Get the Coins Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Coins
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Explore a Crypt in Ravenwood

The Coins is another tarot card that's relatively easy to find. Players need to explore a crypt within Ravenwood to uncover this card.

Decisions made inside the crypt don't affect the outcome of finding a card. If the Sim leaves without the card, players can make them explore again until they find it.

4 How to Get the Wands Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Wands
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Explore a Crypt in Ravenwood

Similarly to the cards mentioned above, the Wands tarot card requires players to explore a crypt in Ravenwood.

5 How to Get the Swords Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Swords
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Explore any Crypt in Ravenwood

In the collection, the Swords tarot card is the final crypt card to discover - although players may find these cards in any random order. Gamers can find this card by exploring the crypts around Ravenwood until it is discovered. It is discoverable in any of the crypts in the Ravenwood neighborhoods.

6 How to Get the Star Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Star
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at The Guardian Tree

The Star tarot card can be found by using Intuition at The Guardian Tree , which is located in Mourningvale, near The Cozy Casket House and the stone circle.

To get The Star card, players must interact with the tree select the Use Intuition option. This may have to be attempted a few times before the card appears.

7 How to Get the Justice Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Justice
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at The Guardian Tree

The Justice tarot card can be discovered when players use Intuition at The Guardian Tree. To find it, they must visit Mourningvale and approach the tree via The Cozy Caskey House nearby. Then, they must click the Use Intuition option to attempt to uncover the card.

8 How to Get the Empress Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Empress
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at The Baleful Bog

The Baleful Bog is a shimmering blue lake in Mourningvale where spirits can be reborn or the living can test out what it is like to be a ghost. It is also the place where players can visit to use their Intuition and try to find The Empress tarot card.

9 How to Get the Evil Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Evil
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at The Well of Longing and Regret

The Evil tarot card is uncovered when players use Intuition at The Well of Longing and Regret in Crow's Crossing. The Sim will be spooked because the angry spirit of Edith is nearby, but they will still be able to find the card.

The tarot card may not show the first few times of trying, so players should stick at it until it appears.

10 How to Get the Tower Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Tower
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at The Well of Longing and Regret

While at The Well of Longing and Regret, players should try using Intuition a few times to uncover as many cards as possible, and this will include The Tower card. Edith may come over and chat, but players can ignore her and the growing fear inside the Sim.

11 How to Get the Wheel Of Fortune Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Wheel Of Fortune
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at Edith's grave

Little Edith is an angry ghost of a child who haunts near The Well of Longing and Regret. Her gravesite is nearby, just south of the well. To get The Wheel Of Fortune tarot card, players must visit Edith's grave and click to Use Intuition. This also works at any of the Specter graves in the center of Crow's Crossing.

12 How to Get the Suspension Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Suspension
  • Rarity: Uncommon
  • Requirement: Use Intuition at Edith's grave

Suspension can be found by either using Intuition at Edith's grave, like in The Wheel Of Fortune above, or by using the levitation power learned in Ghost Mastery. Using Intuition is the easiest way to find this card, but using levitation is a lot more fun.

13 How to Get the Hermit Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Hermit
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Purchase from the Mysterious Merchant for 200 Simoleons

A simple enough card to find, but it may take a few attempts before Waylon Warez, the Mysterious Merchant in The Sims 4 's Ravenwood, has it in stock.

Waylon can be found standing around in the Eternal Hollow Ceremony, at the Ravenwood Family Festival in Crow's Crossing, or at the Thinned Festiveil in Mourningvale .

14 How to Get the Chariot Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Chariot
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Purchase from Waylon Warez for $200

The Chariot tarot card is also purchasable from Waylon Warez in Mourningvale or Crow's Crossing. If he does not yet have it in stock then players may want to purchase something else and try again later. After a couple of attempts, he will have it for sale.

15 How to Get the World Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The World
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Interact with a crow

This is easily achieved if players find Waylon in Crow's Crossing, as there is a crow on a perch just nearby. If not, the Grim Standard Ascendant Crow is readily available to purchase from Build Mode for 825 Simoleons. To get the card, players have to interact with the crow on the perch, but they'll want to avoid provoking, as it can lead to an untimely death for the Sim.

16 How to Get the Temperance Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: Temperance
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Seek catharsis from a Specter

To get the Temperance tarot card, gamers will have to visit the Specters in the children's park at Crow's Crossing. However, it will only work if the Sim is in a negative mood, such as Sad or Uncomfortable. Gamers can approach one of the small, blue ghostly blobs and click Seek Catharsis to earn the Temperance tarot card and add it to the deck.

17 How to Get the Moon Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Moon
  • Rarity: Common
  • Requirement: Get dirty hands at the Moon Revelry Festival

To get the Moon tarot card in The Sims 4 , players will want to send their Sim to the Moon Revelry Festival to dig in a patch of dirt. The festival occurs every night in Whispering Glen from 7:20 PM to 11:20 PM at the Ancestor Face Cliff. To get there, gamers can travel to the nearby residential lot, Hay Hill Landing, and find the festival close by.

18 How to Get the Advocate Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Advocate
  • Rarity: Rare
  • Requirement: Complete Macabre Mysteries favor for The Grim Enthusiast

One of the Order of Lenore is Nyon Specter, The Grim Enthusiast. Nyon lives in the Specter Family Manor at Crow's Crossing with his mother Olive, and his stepfather. He can also be found lurking at the Ravenwood Family Festival. To get The Advocate tarot card, gamers have to speak to Nyon and select Offer To Help With Favor. They can choose to have two active favors at one time, and each favor rewards the Sim with a tarot card once all three requirements are complete.

To complete the required goals, players have to visit the Specter Family grave sites found in Crow's Crossing and read each of the epitaphs. Next, they must speak to Waylon Warez and purchase four Souls before finally reporting back to Nyon.

19 How to Get the Fool Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Fool
  • Rarity: Rare
  • Requirement: Complete Grim Beginnings favor for The Grim Enthusiast

Just like before, players will have to speak to Nyon Specter at the Specter Family Manor or the Ravenwood Family Festival and select Offer To Help With Favor. Next, they will have to find the Grim Reaper.

Grim is usually found wandering Mourningvale or at his workplace, which players can access by joining the Reaper career. The Fool tarot card is obtained by first speaking to Grim and then giving him the gnome from Nyon. Once done, players will have to report back to Nyon.

20 How to Get the Lovers Tarot Card in The Sims 4

  • Tarot Card: The Lovers
  • Rarity: Rare
  • Requirement: Complete the Unfinished Boo-siness favor for the Widowed Father

The Widowed Father is Ekade Aether, one of the four Order of Lenore. He lives with his child in Whispering Glen or can be found dancing the night away at the Moon Revelry Festival. To start this task, players have to speak to Ekade and select Offer To Help With Favor.

Then, to get The Lovers tarot card, they must talk to a ghost and then attend Afterlife Anonymous to ask three ghosts about Unfinished Business. Afterlife Anonymous meetings take place on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at 6 PM to 11 PM and also on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10 AM to 4 PM. After completing those tasks, they can return and speak to Ekade Aether.

item.title: The 17 Best EA Games, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • EA has improved its image by focusing on single-player games and reworking microtransactions.
  • EA has released great games like Fallen Order, FIFA 15, and more that appeal to fans.
  • Respawn acquisition helped EA overcome disappointments with games like Battlefield.

There are many people around who are very eager to label EA as one of the worst gaming companies of all time, but the truth is that this organization has tried its hardest to turn its image around after becoming the punching bag of the gaming industry. Their renewed focus on single-player games while trying to rework how they integrate microtransactions has done a great job of letting players appreciate them instead of calling them out time and time again.

There are many great games with EA's label on them that have become some of the best video game experiences that fans can expose themselves to. The best EA games encompass a wide range of genres and will be quite appealing to gamers with varying and selective tastes.

Updated on November 5, 2024, by Mehrdad Khayyat: Despite being quite an unpopular publisher, Electronic Arts has backed many of the greatest games we have played since the original PlayStation was a thing. Although the company has also butchered some spectacular franchises, it still keeps some promising IPs alive!

EA is one of those companies that had a far better past than the present, especially with all the disappointments that came with Battlefield 2024, Anthem, and Mass Effect Andromeda. However, the acquisition of Respawn Entertainment did help the publisher a lot with managing the expectations.

17 Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order

Resurrecting Story-Driven Star Wars Games Under Respawn

Fallen Order 's launch was rough, with a wealth of bugs marring what should've been a fun experience. Thankfully, Respawn wasted no time in ironing out the kinks, letting players enjoy an incredible video game that is arguably one of the finest single-player Star Wars games around.

Cal Kestis is a compelling protagonist who ends up playing a major role without being too grating in the process. Jedi: Survivor continues the story of this hero, and it's a shame that the launch of this title somehow managed to be even more broken than its predecessor.

16 FIFA 15

One Of The Most Balanced Games In The Series Ever

Most people would just dismiss the FIFA series and comment on the fact that every title is pretty much interchangeable when it comes to the gameplay. While this is true to an extent, there's no denying that the polished gameplay of this annual sports video game series makes the act of controlling one's favorite soccer team to score goals a highly engaging one.

FIFA 12 and 15 are considered by many to be two of the best games in the long-running series, with the latter edging out the former because of how fun its gameplay felt. Later titles have tried to make some changes to the gameplay with varying degrees of success, but FIFA 15 continues to stand strong as one of the greatest sports games that deserves all the time in the spotlight, and then some.

15 Command And Conquer: Generals

Highly Replayable RTS With Deep Gameplay Mechanics And Varied Factions

Unfortunately, Electronic Arts no longer invests in RTS games, but the company already owns the IP for one of the most brilliant franchises in the genre. The Command And Conquer series is a massive universe that branches out into multiple sub-franchises each with many different titles.

Generals , and its expansion Zero Hour , was probably the most memorable game from the Command And Conquer series depicting modern-day warfare. The game featured only three playable factions, but the difference between them was deep enough to add up significantly to the replayability value. Also, each faction featured a unique campaign with challenging missions.

14 Dragon Age: Inquisition

Elevating The Dragon Age Experience To A New Height In Storytelling And Gameplay

Despite the many problems that plagued Dragon Age: Inquisition during its development, most people agreed that it was a solid addition to the franchise and a step in the right direction after Dragon Age 2 attempted to make the franchise appeal to a broader market. Forming an Inquisition and saving the world from Corypheus' malevolence is a blast, especially with the many things players can do along the way.

The idea of separating the story into DLCs was maligned by many, but Inquisition has slowly garnered a positive reputation over time. It's easy to see why players are hotly anticipating the release of Dragon Age: The Veilguard , even if the reveal of this game worried many. Fans will be replaying this game right now to keep their memory fresh when it comes to the series' impressive lore.

13 Dragon Age: Origins

A Solid Foundation For A Long-Living Franchise

The acquisition of BioWare by EA allowed the studio to flex a big budget in their game like never before. After being hailed as the king of the CRPG genre, the company moved to a more mainstream action-focused title with the advent of Dragon Age: Origins .

The experiment was a massive success, with the varying origins of the player character, a rich fantasy world, and some great storytelling turning Dragon Age: Origins into one of the most beloved Western RPGs of all time. To this day, fans still consider this game to be the best title in the series, and understandably so.

12 The Sims 3

Expanding The Series Into An Open-World Experience

Most people consider The Sims 3 to be the best game in this popular life simulation series, with the inclusion of a seamless open world and new mechanics being seen as groundbreaking by many. While this game could be rather demanding for PCs at the time, it didn't take long before post-launch support for this game stabilized the experience.

This, coupled with the wealth of new content that was added, made The Sims 3 one of the best video games ever made. The reason why so many people continue to be disappointed by The Sims 4 is because it was a step down from its predecessor in many ways, and fans can only hope that The Sims 5 doesn't repeat the same mistakes.

11 It Takes Two

The Most Brilliant Co-Op Experience From An Indie Developer

After working on A Way Out , Josef Fares went all out in the development of a co-op story-driven game that ended up being one of the best titles that fans can get their hands on. It Takes Two focuses on the story of Cody and May, two people in a strained marriage and on the verge of getting a divorce when their child, Rose, wishes for a way to make them see past their differences.

This turns them into two dolls who have to go through a wide range of challenges that switch up the gameplay in fresh and engaging ways. It Takes Two was lauded for its incredible gameplay, even if the narrative was a bit too cliched and uninteresting for most people, who considered it to be the weakest part of the experience.

10 Burnout Paradise

The Peak Of Stunt Racing And A Memorable Conclusion To The Series

It's a shame that no new title in the Burnout series has arrived after all this time, with a remaster of Burnout Paradise being the only thing that fans have enjoyed recently. It's a shame that this franchise has remained dormant for so long, but the fact that fans were reminded of the excellence present in Burnout Paradise was a nice treat nevertheless.

The game is arcade racing at its best, allowing players to take out other races in the most ostentatious manner possible. It's impossible to start up a session and get bored of Burnout Paradise because of the sheer carnage that can arise from its scintillating racing gameplay.

9 Need For Speed: Most Wanted (2005)

The Ultimate Illegal Racing Experience In A Massive Open-World City

While many think Underground 2 was the peak of the Need For Speed series, Most Wanted did manage to deliver a better world with more gameplay variety and, of course, a longer list of drivable cars.

Probably the only thing that Most Wanted lacked was a customization system with the same details as Underground 2 . Most Wanted even expanded the Police vs Racers gameplay, as it became a core part of the progression to increase the wanted level intentionally. Using environmental objects to get rid of the chasers was another impressive innovation in Most Wanted .

8 Dead Space

Redefining The Borders Between A Horror And A Third-Person Shooter

The fact that one of the greatest survival horror games ever made was greenlit by EA is a testament to the studio's penchant to put their eggs in riskier baskets from time to time. Visceral Games developed one of the most atmospheric and entertaining horror titles, with Dead Space 's claustrophobic atmosphere and immersive design making it one of the best EA games in the eyes of many.

Isaac Clarke's grisly adventures aboard the USG Ishimura make for a captivating time, with players having to deal with necromorphs and other grisly enemies in a game packed with gore and disturbing moments. A huge part of the storyline involves Isaac's hunt for her girlfriend only to find out that the Marker was causing him to hallucinate whenever he thought he was speaking to Nicole.

7 Apex Legends

Introducing The Core Of Titanfall Into The Battle Royale Genre

Live-service games have attained somewhat of a poor reputation in the industry, with many players feeling like these games are nothing more than elaborate schemes to eat through as much of a player's funds as possible. Regardless of how true this statement may be, there's no denying that some live-service titles have extremely fun gameplay loops, with Apex Legends being a great example of the same.

The movement mechanics in this game are truly impressive and are the best part of the experience by a country mile. While there are some pay-to-win mechanics in Apex Legends , they aren't anywhere near as egregious as most people would expect from a free-to-play title.

6 Battlefield 1

The Most Impressive Depiction Of World War 1 In A Multiplayer Game

It's not easy to become an iconic game for a certain part of the history in human life, but Battlefield 1 managed to do it flawlessly. World War 1 never received much love from game developers before Battlefield 1 , as the level of weaponry advancements was not impressive enough to offer a wide variety in gunplay.

However, DICE broke this deadlock and delivered a multiplayer experience set in World War 1 that became one of the best-ever games in the history of first-person shooters. Battlefield 1 was one of the few multiplayer games with horses, blades, guns, and zeppelins, all present in a single battle, and all being decently balanced.

5 Titanfall 2

One Of The Few Games Ever With Perfect Campaign And Multiplayer

Titanfall 2 is one of the most underrated sequels in gaming history. Not only did it address all the problems of the first game and improve the groundbreaking traversal system, but it also features a single-player campaign that is entertaining and emotional at the same time.

It's saddening that this game didn't match EA's sales expectations, which led to the cancellation of Titanfall 3 with EA putting all their resources into developing Apex Legends instead. This bargain may have worked for EA, but it came at the cost of a sequel that had the potential to be one of the greatest FPS games ever made if its predecessor was anything to go by.

4 Dead Space 2

Evolving The Horror Elements Of The First Game With Improved Visuals

The first game in the Dead Space series made for a great immersive time as players took on the role of Isaac Clarke and explored the desolate halls of the USG Ishimura. When Dead Space 2 rolled out, fans were pleasantly surprised to see how far things were pushed in this amazing game.

There was a greater focus on action over horror, but that did nothing to take away from Dead Space 's amazing atmosphere in the slightest. The game had the power to terrify the player in each combat encounter, and it helped that everything from the story to the presentation was a step up from the first game.

3 The Sims 2

A Massive Leap Over The Original Game In Simulating A Romantic Life

There's no denying that Maxis had settled on a winning formula with the advent of The Sims . However, the game was still rough around the edges and needed some polishing before this life sim could become even more popular. With their publisher's guidance, the sequel to this title ended up being one of the best EA games around that fans still look back on fondly to this day.

The Sims 2 single-handedly established many iconic aspects of the series and let players enjoy a video game with incredible freedom and intricate mechanics. With numerous expansion packs ensuring that this game remained relevant for years, it's easy to see why The Sims 2 attracted so many fans to the series and turned the franchise into a household name.

2 Crysis

A Challenging First-Person Shooter With GPU-Melting Visuals

Crysis blew everyone's minds when it launched, with the graphics of this title being so advanced that even high-end rigs at the time had a problem running this game. The revolutionary CryEngine was a huge reason why this game was so ahead of its time, ensuring that players would remember this title as one of the best EA games ever made.

Controlling Nomad and using his nanosuit to take out hostile soldiers makes for a great time, with players accessing their power fantasies as they become invisible and use the enhanced power of their nanosuit to grab hapless soldiers and fling them around like ragdolls. Players who managed to run Crysis at the time were more than impressed by its immense graphics that look even better in the Remastered edition of this title.

1 Mass Effect (Original Trilogy)

Bioware's Best Work Ever On An RPG With Compelling Storytelling

This entry includes spoilers for the finale of Mass Effect 2 .

When Mass Effect came out, many people were glad to see BioWare make a return to the sci-fi genre with an epic tale that players absolutely loved. The first game may have some gameplay quirks that are hard to ignore now, but the Legendary Edition takes care of this gripe and lets players have way more fun with the gameplay of the first Mass Effect .

To this day, the narrative and characters of Mass Effect 2 continue to hold a special place in the hearts of fans. The suicide mission is easily one of the best ending sequences in any video game ever. This is precisely what makes the conclusion of the final title in the trilogy such a disappointing one.

For what it's worth, the additional content gave some closure with certain beloved characters and expanded on the endings to make things more satisfying. Most people agree that Mass Effect 3 is one of the greatest games ever made until its ending, which is the best statement to personify what the discourse around this title boils down to.

item.title: Free PS Plus Games for November 2024 Are Available Now
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The PS Plus monthly games for November 2024 are now available to claim for subscribers.
  • The November 2024 monthly lineup for PS Plus sees the inclusion of a brand-new day one game: DEATH NOTE Killer Within.
  • PS Plus has also added Xbox first-party game Ghostwire: Tokyo and Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged for November 2024.

PlayStation Plus subscribers can now download the service's free monthly games for November 2024. For years, Sony has offered a rotating set of three to four games as a monthly PS Plus perk, and November 2024's lineup looks rather appealing with a brand-new day one release, a fun Hot Wheels racer, and an open-world horror game.

As established in 2022's major PS Plus restructuring, the service has three separate tiers for subscribers to choose from. Where PS Plus Extra and Premium offer a huge catalog of games and classics for a higher price, the Essential tier is the service's entry-level option that has remained virtually unchanged from how PS Plus operated prior to the restructure. PS Plus Essential unlocks online multiplayer functionality for games and offers perks like the aforementioned monthly titles, exclusive PlayStation Store discounts, cloud saves, and more.

The free PS Plus games for November 2024 were announced last week, and right on schedule, Sony has made them available to download on the first Tuesday of the month. PS Plus subscribers across all tiers can now add Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged , Ghostwire: Tokyo , and DEATH NOTE Killer Within to their libraries. Out of this trio, DEATH NOTE Killer Within is a standout addition as it's a day one release for PS Plus. This is the second day one game for the service in recent memory, with The Plucky Squire launching into PS Plus Extra and Premium back in September 2024.

PS Plus Free Monthly Games List for November 2024

November 2024 PS Plus Lineup Includes Xbox First-Party Game

  • DEATH NOTE Killer Within
  • Ghostwire: Tokyo
  • Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged

Both PS4 and PS5 players can enjoy DEATH NOTE Killer Within and Hot Wheels Unleashed 2: Turbocharged , but Ghostwire: Tokyo is only playable on PS5 . The supernatural action-adventure game by recently-revived Japanese studio Tango Gameworks initially launched in 2022 as a timed exclusive for the PS5 and made its way to Xbox Series X/S and PC a year later. Ghostwire: Tokyo 's addition to PS Plus is also interesting since it marks another instance of an Xbox first-party game being offered in the service's monthly lineup, with the last one being Minecraft Legends in April 2024.

Overall, the November 2024 lineup of free monthly games for PS Plus looks quite solid. From horror to racing to social deduction, there's a lot of genre diversity to suit different tastes. As far as the PS Plus Extra and Premium additions go, Sony has yet to announce the games coming to the tiers this month. However, the Last Chance to Play section has confirmed that 18 games will depart PS Plus in November 2024, so Extra and Premium subscribers only have a few weeks left to play them if interested.

item.title: Rumor: Resident Evil 9 Leak Reveals Playable Characters and More
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • New Resident Evil 9 leak suggests Leon S. Kennedy and Jill Valentine are the main playable characters.
  • Possible locations in Resident Evil 9 include an abandoned hospital, caves, forest, a factory, and a temple.
  • Fans should treat leaks with a grain of salt until Capcom confirms details.

A supposed Resident Evil 9 leak claims to reveal a slew of details about the upcoming survival-horror game. Capcom has yet to officially announce Resident Evil 9 , but the game's release is inevitable. After all, Capcom has been releasing new Resident Evil games on a regular basis for nearly three decades at this point.

New Resident Evil games come out on an almost annual basis, with 2023 being one of the rare exceptions. No new Resident Evil game is releasing this year, breaking a streak that started with 2019's Resident Evil 2 remake, but rumor has it that 2025 will see the release of Resident Evil 9 . Additional rumors have potentially revealed details about the game's story and gameplay, though fans should definitely take the information with a massive grain of salt.

The source of the rumor is Biohazard Declassified, citing an alleged playtester who claims to have played Resident Evil 9 . If the leaks are to be believed, Resident Evil 9 's main characters will apparently be Leon S. Kennedy and Jill Valentine, investigating an island tied to Eveline and the Megamycete. Other returning characters are said to include Chris Redfield and Barry Burton in non-playable capacities.

Rumored Resident Evil 9 Characters

  • Jill Valentine (Playable)
  • Leon S. Kennedy (Playable)
  • Barry Burton
  • Chris Redfield

The leaker claims to have revealed some of the locations that Resident Evil 9 players will visit on the island, which will supposedly include an abandoned hospital, caves, a dark forest, an abandoned factory, a laboratory, and a temple, so typical Resident Evil fare. Enemies are said to include "evolved zombies" similar to Resident Evil 4 's Ganados, a "stalker" enemy that stalks Leon (like Nemesis or Mr. X), and a Goatman enemy that Jill will have to fight. The main villain in the game is said to be "Mr. Simon."

Now, before fans put too much stock into these leaks, it's best to keep in mind that there is no way of verifying this information until Capcom itself decides to pull the curtain back on Resident Evil 9 . There have been plenty of accurate Resident Evil series leaks over the years, but there have also been many leaks and rumors that have never come to fruition. As always, fans should keep their expectations in check.

Luckily, it's possible fans will learn the truth about Resident Evil 9 sooner rather than later. Rumors persist that a possible Resident Evil 9 reveal will happen at The Game Awards 2024, with the game then released in the second half of 2025. Nothing official to that effect has actually been announced, but Resident Evil fans should make sure to tune in to The Game Awards on December 12 just in case.
